body:
I have the following in my `packages.yaml`:

```
    openmpi:
        paths:
            openmpi@1.10.1: /usr/local/other/SLES11.3/openmpi/1.10.1/gcc-5.3
        buildable: False
```

That is resulting in the following warning on `spack install`:

```
==> Building hdf5
==> Successfully installed hdf5
  Fetch: 0.79s.  Build: 9m 1.92s.  Total: 9m 2.71s.
[+] /gpfsm/dnb53/rpfische/spack3/opt/spack/linux-SuSE11-x86_64/gcc-5.3.0/hdf5-1.10.0-patch1-a3wlvmdk77m2hz5mgyw2lexuwforrwx6
==> Warning: Dependency missing due to corrupt install directory:
  /usr/local/other/SLES11.3/openmpi/1.10.1/gcc-5.3
  Install prefix exists but contains no spec.yaml:
      /usr/local/other/SLES11.3/openmpi/1.10.1/gcc-5.3
==> Trying to fetch from file:///gpfsm/dnb53/rpfische/spack3/var/spack/cache/netcdf/netcdf-4.4.1.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /gpfsm/dnb53/rpfische/spack3/var/spack/stage/netcdf-4.4.1-zogkcaukxe57bjh5upr3iakwo7pt7qqf/netcdf-4.4.1.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /gpfsm/dnb53/rpfische/spack3/var/spack/stage/netcdf-4.4.1-zogkcaukxe57bjh5upr3iakwo7pt7qqf
```

Other than that, the install seems to be going OK (for now).

Any idea of what this is?
title: Spurious Warning on "corrupt install directory?
